ygData.subject: Re: Nagafen Problems
ygData.msgSnippet: I have something similar happen with my game. I can t remember the details of the fight(s), but I do remember it happened one time zoneing from Qeynos to Q.
ygData.messageBody:
I have something similar happen with my game. I can't remember the details of the fight(s), but I do
remember it happened one time zoneing from Qeynos to Q. Hills.

my arrow keys (forward and back) no longer move my character, instead they scroll through the text I
have typed in before. (/ignore <whoever>, "sorry, guys I died and will be back as soon as I mem my
spells and run back", etc.) Don't remember if it affected hotkeys, shortcuts <i> <s> etc. My cursor
gets locked into mouselook mode, so I can't control my cursor to click on stuff.

the keypad movement keys were unaffected but I never use them, so they weren't really of much help.
I would usually have to camp and comeback for it to go away. Although, once it cleared up when I
zoned again.

I never reported it or anything... usually it happened when my group needs me so I would just try to
get it resolved and get back to nuking. By the time things would calm down so I could report it, i
would have forgotten about it already.

kale usi wrote:
>
> From: "kale usi" <kaleusi@...>
>
> >From: Jean-Christian Sokol <jcsokol@...>
> >
> > From: Douglas Babcock [SMTP:dbabcock@...]
> >
> > >Heres the problem we encountered and I need to know If anyone else
> >has seen
> > >this.
> >
> > >3 of our casters, 2 clerics and 1 enchanter lost the ability to
> >cast spells
> > >during the melee.
> >
> > I was playing with a friend yesterday, in Befallen too, and at one
> >time my keyboard went out. I hit the hotkeys but NOTHING happened. I could
> >talk, but couldn't <i>nventory, <a>ttack, etc. I had to /exit. And then
> >log
> >again.
> >
> > Saoryn, Wiz 15, Tunare.
>
> Same thing has happened to me, my brother and several friends. We all
> submitted /bug reports about it, and that was the last we ever heard of the
> problem. It still continues to happen though.
>
> We all play on Bertoxxulous.
